item.title: Cv
item.description: Education PhD Student, Population Biology Graduate Group, University of California Davis, Davis, CA, Fall 2016 – Present, Advisor: Jeff Ross-Ibarra B.A., Biology, University of Chicago, Chicago, IL, 2014 Publications Hudson, A. I., Fleming-Davies, A. E., Páez, D. J. and Dwyer, G. (2016), Genotype-by-genotype interactions between an insect and its pathogen. J. Evol. Biol., 29: 2480–2490. (http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/jeb.12977/). Awards 2017, Collaborative Seed Grant, Center for Population Biology, UC Davis Teaching Experience Teaching Assistant, University of California Davis, Davis, CA

item.title: About
item.description: I’m a PhD student in the Population Biology Graduate Group at UC Davis and a member of the Ross-Ibarra Lab. I study how plants adapt to their environment. My current work looks at stress resistance in maize with a focus on genotype by environment interactions, which cause the same genetic sequence to have different effects in different environments.
